#Text=Japanese nuclear plant operators ordered to compensate affected families amid calls for prime minister to resign
#Text=Saturday , April 16 , 2011
#Text=The crisis at the flooded Fukushima I nuclear power plant has now been designated on par with the Chernobyl disaster in 1986 .
#Text=Image : kawamoto takuo .
#Text=File photograph of Akihito , who visited northeast Japan this week to meet survivors of the tsunami which devastated the area .
#Text=Image : Shawnc .
#Text=Thousands of people were left dead and many more are missing after the disaster .
#Text=This image shows the flooding which devastated Sendai airport .
#Text=Image : U.S. Air Force .

#Text=The operators of the stricken Fukushima I nuclear power plant in northeast Japan have been ordered to pay compensation to families affected by the ongoing crisis at the site , amid calls for the resignation of the Japanese prime minister over how he is handling the crisis , which has now been designated on par with the Chernobyl disaster in 1986 .

#Text=Japanese officials ordered TEPCO to pay ¥ 1million ( US$ 12thousand , £ 7.35thousand ) to each household affected by the crisis , which the company says will add up to approximately ¥ 50billion ( US$ 599million , £ 367million ) .
#Text=Earlier this week , officials announced plans to expand the nuclear exclusion zone around the plant to include five more communities as radiation continues to leak from the plant .

#Text=Pressure is now mounting for the resignation of Naoto Kan , the Japanese prime minister , for his handling of the nuclear crisis in Fukushima ; some of his opponents have called for an independent inquiry into how he reacted to the disaster .
#Text=TEPCO has this week announced plans to move equipment to higher ground after a series of strong aftershocks that have hampered efforts to repair the crippled facility .
#Text=Officials have warned some of the nuclear rods in the reactors at the plant may have been damaged , but likely remain intact .
#Text=Workers at the plant are still fighting a desperate battle to stop radiation leaking from the plant , but have been hit by constant setbacks .

#Text=Earlier this week officials of NISA , the Japanese government nuclear authority , said officials had upgraded the crisis to a level seven on the International Nuclear Event Scale — the same applied to the Chernobyl disaster — designating the crisis as a " major accident " with " wider consequences " than previously thought .

column1: #Text=" We have upgraded the severity level to seven as the impact of radiation leaks has been widespread from the air , vegetables , tap water and the ocean , " he said .

#Text=Akihito , the emperor of Japan , travelled to the northeast of the country on Wednesday to visit survivors of the tsunami which devastated the area last month against a backdrop of mounting anger over the at a nuclear plant , where technicians are continuing to battle to cool the reactors as radiation continues to leak from the site .
#Text=Akihito and his wife , Michiko , met people displaced by the tragedy at two emergency shelters in Asahi , near the northeast coast where the tsunami struck .
#Text=140,000 people are now living in emergency shelters across Japan after their homes were destroyed in the disaster .

#Text=Emergency workers , dressed in protective white suits , gloves and goggles , have began searching for bodies within the exclusion zone around the stricken nuclear plant , much of which was left muddied and destroyed by the tsunami .
#Text=Officials fear up to 1,000 bodies may be among the wreckage in the area .

#Text=Search efforts in the area have been put off because of high radiation levels , but authorities want to recover bodies before they deteriorate to the point where they become a health hazard and impossible to identify .
#Text=I am physically and mentally worn out by the nuclear crisis .
#Text=They [ the government ] have done nothing so far to help us .
#Text=— Yoshihisa Kato , businessman in Fukushima
#Text=Japanese television reported radiation levels in the ocean off the plant have fallen but remain high .

#Text=Health officials have found radiation 25 times the legal limit in fish caught south of the nuclear plant , and radioactivity had been detected in 11 different vegetables in Fukushima earlier this week .
#Text=The death toll from the disaster is continuing to rise ; Japanese police have reported 13,300 people have been confirmed dead and more than 15,000 are still missing .
#Text=Another aftershock , with a magnitude of 6.1 , struck on Thursday morning , following a more powerful one , measuring magnitude 6.6 , on Monday .
#Text=Hundreds of aftershocks have rattled northeast Japan in the month since the initial earthquake .

#Text=Before the aftershock on Monday , people across Japan marked the one month anniversary of the earthquake with a moment of silence , and Kan paid tribute to countries who had sent aid to the stricken country .
#Text=However , Kan has been criticised for his handling of the nuclear crisis .
#Text=An entrepreneur in Fukushima , Yoshihisa Kato , complained about how he had been left abandoned by the government .
#Text=" I am physically and mentally worn out by the nuclear crisis , " he said .
#Text=" They have done nothing so far to help us .
